intro: Brachystelma perditum, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and distinctive, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, cylindrical stems. Its flowers, which bloom in shades of pink and white, are typically short-lived but highly attractive to pollinators. Brachystelma perditum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in dry conditions.
